p: Territory of Washington County of Walla Walla In? District Court 1st Judicial Disrict Washington Territory

In the matter of the application of J H Sheffler and Josephine Sheffler for writ of Habeas Corpus Now Comes John B Montague the Defendant against whom the said J H Sheffler and Josephine Sheffler have made complaint in the above entitled and for to said complainant and as a return to said writ on his shows to the Honorable Court the following facts

1st Defendant admits that said child is in his custody and under his control and that of his wife under and by virtue of said agreement in complaint mentioned and set forth, which said agreement is hereby refused to and part of this to the same purpose and effect as if herein and defendant alleges that he has and duly herefore all the conditions and covenants in said agreement contained and on his part to be kept or performed

2 Defendant denies that said restraint was or is illegal; denies that he totally or otherwise disregarded his said covenant or any or either of them; denies that he has said child in or about a saloone where vile or other improper language was used in her presence or hearing, and denies that he has caused her or is now causing her or that he has allowed her to associate with the vile or with women of ill fame or other improper
Defendant further shows to the Honorable Court that some several months before the of said agreement the said Josephine Sheffler voluntarily let said Defendant have said child and placed placed the same in his family to be by his and his wife raised and educated and that said child was then sick and requested and medical aid, and that Defendant and his wife cared for her and employed a Physician to attend on her at a great to Defendant; that during all that time and after the time of the exception of said agreement Defendant lived and Kept said saloon where he now lives and Keeps the same, and that complainants well know the place of residence and the and of the Defendants; and Defendant for alleges that he has during all the time said had been under his care, clothed, , cared for, and sent her to school and treated her in all aspects as he would his own child and that he and his said wife have become strongly and affectionately attached to said child and that her attachment for is no less than that of an affectionate child for its comfort Wherefore Defendant prays that said writ is disarmed and that the custody of said child be back to the defendant and for his costs and
Kennedy and George Defendants attys Territory of Washington County of Walla Walla

John B Montague having duly sworn says that he is the defendant in the above entitled case; that he knows the contents of the foregoing and believes the same to be true J. B. Montague Subscribed and sworn to be true the this 13th day of Nov 1876 of the
